revised_title: A Detailed Analytical Study of the Pyrolysis of n-Butane
tldr: The authors conducted a detailed analytical study of the pyrolysis of n-butane, focusing on the formation of products and reaction rates. They found that the uninhibited pyrolysis of paraffins is more complex than previously thought, and the free-radical mechanism proposed by Rice provides a good quantitative account of the reactions. The study also highlights the importance of gas chromatography in analyzing reaction products and measuring reaction rates accurately.
